channel.title: front-ends on The R Blog
channel.description: Recent content in front-ends on The R Blog

item.title: Long input lines
item.description: When using R interactively via a console, one edits a line of input, confirms it by pressing ENTER, then R parses the line, evaluates it, prints the output and lets the user enter another line. This is also known as REPL (Read-Eval-Print-Loop). The maximum length of the input line is sometimes limited. It is essentially impossible that one would run into a limit when typing the commands, but there was a report from a user who pasted generated content to the console and have ran into a limit of 4096 bytes.
